name: A Date in the Park
description: A short and mysterious free point and click adventure game, inspired by the feeling of oddness in an everyday situation.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 500 MHz Memory: 128 MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 187 MB available space Additional Notes: Video: DirectX & Directdraw Supported
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: 1 GHz+ Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9 graphics device DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 187 MB available space

reviews.review_text: An excellent and extremely surprising short (and free) adventure game! Just try it for yourself - and you won't be dissapointed.  And I even have it translated into Russian :)

I felt slightly uneasy playing this game, but only because I thought it was going to go in a completely different direction. When the actual horror arrive it was genuinely shocking. Decent game and the price is more than right.
It's free and it's an interesting game for the little over half an hour it lasts. I enjoyed it

This is a spoiler-free review. A Date in the Park is a free point and click adventure title with hints of horror and mystery. You control a man named Lou, who has recently moved to Lisbon, Portugal from London, England. Being in the country for just a matter of days, Lou met Catarina, a woman that he really connected with, in a bar and agreed to meet her at her favorite park.  When it comes down to gameplay and mechanics, there's nothing that sets this title apart from the rest of the retro point and click crowd. It's everything that you would expect it to be. However, the 90's digitized photo graphics are a nice touch, and bring an overall nostalgic feel to the game. You will wander around the park in search of Catarina, while solving simple puzzles and enjoying the off-beat atmosphere that is abound.  So if the game is simple, and not really all that groundbreaking, why am I recommending it? Well, I can't tell you... that's the mystery. You truly need to find out for yourself. The heart of A Date in the Park lies within its unexpected twists and unsettling vibe. The game also does a good job at making you feel lost and helpless, since all of the people that you interact with reply in Portuguese while Lou only knows English; of course this effect isn't the same if you actually do know Portuguese. The game is free, and it only lasts 30 minutes, so you've really got nothing to lose but half an hour if you don't enjoy yourself. However, I can't foresee that happening. Go ahead and give A Date in the Park a shot, and enjoy the enigma within.   Rating:  3.0/5.0  - Average, can take it or leave it.
Worst date of my life, plus/minus ballons and naked stone ladies.   Lesson learned: Never pick up chics in parks.. or ducks.

This was...an interesting game to say at least. The lack of a soundtrack and just nature sounds makes it hauntingly eerie. The gameplay isn't too hard to follow and the mapping isn't too complicated but just enough to forget where you are times out of panic. Now for the story, (blocking in case of spoilers)    The plot overall had a LOT of potential, and I know this was a short game, but I kind of wish they went more into how's and why's. I dunno, unless they intend to make a 2nd, I really don't like being left with answers. But despite all of this I do like that it was in a strange scenario where you can't ask for help. That did save it from the lack of er...plot.    I would probably recommend this game to any of my friends who are starting off with odd creepy games to test the waters. As for experienced horror/creepy fans like myself, well it is a good way to kill some time.
Named the duckling 'fvker' and the rest is just hilarious. Try it for yourself :P

I came into this game knowing it was a horror game. Now, personally myself, I am not a big horror fan. However, this game was just enough horror to enjoy myself in it, while not    sh*ting    my pants. Overall, this game is a great game and if you have the time you should give it a go.

You recently moved to Lisbon and suddenly found your other half.  You decided to meet up at the park, where, once arrived, something seems a bit off... but one thing that you are sure about is that she will come. (...Right?)  A slow-pacing game with a tiny bit of creepy atmosphere which keeps you wondering if something will be happening at all, at that so-calm desolated place.  It might be lacking a bit of background story, but in my opinion the amount of content is just right as it is.  I had to come back to the same points a couple of times, nevertheless, counting the duration of the game, didn't find myself getting bored at all.
Oh boy, what did I just play... I totally wasn't expecting that. Anyways, it was worth it. Don't trust the ducks.
I loved the game, not really that scary for a horror game but still good.
10/10 would date again

'It's going to be alright ♥♥♥♥ling, i will look after you'  Short, simple, but yet enjoyable P&C with nice graphics, audio wich won't take you more than one hour (I'm kinda slow at games like these) to finish. Good story with a twist, totally worth it!
This is a fun , short little Interractive adventure game. Reminded me of the good ol King Quest days. Worth the 30 minutes or so it will take you to go through the game.

This game just gets violent very quickly and ends very rapidly. Yes, you can predict the ending before it happens but I still enjoyed playing the game. The ending still made me like 'Whoa, that just happened...', but I wish that it was longer and had more of an ending/storyline but it is a free game. All together it wasn't a bad game.
Great little retro adventure game !
It's a fun game if you like a certain kind of humour and twists. ;)
That was very disturbing. Well done.
fukk that duck
dont trust the duck

Okay first review ever...  A very nicely done point and click game. Kind of surprise me cause I wasn't expecting that, the lil duck was one thing.  It's a short game and a quick play, but aye it's free and it ain't bad.
Best experienced without knowing portugese.
Interesting albeit very linear and simplistic point & click adventure that ended up creeping the ♥♥♥♥ out of me on more than one level.  Worth spending half an hour playing this!
This game is actually pretty good, and to be honest I would like a full game like this and much longer.

I must say I'm impressed. Surprisingly enjoyable little adventure game with a beautiful setting and an abundance of small details. When you try to stick a door key inside a window, it doesn't just give you an ordinary 'no point' message, but it says, 'There is no keyhole in this window'. Also, it gives you a lot to explore and really gets you immersed for a couple of hours. However, I am a bit confused with the final plot twist, I think it would be better if there were multiple endings (and some explanation wouldn't do any harm). This could make a great thriller/psycholgical horror game had it been longer and choise-based. They say the whole story has something to do with the Greek mythology that is referred to several times through the game. I have yet to look that up.
I am high while playing this and it is really good
Uncanny valley, the game :P
Absolutely fantastic 10/10
Its like Gone Girl ! I recommend you guys to check this out :),The only thing that bothered me was the ending and the last part where you need to right click the hole in the statue.
Short, but I was aware of that going into it. Definitely worth it if you've got a little time to spare. I thought I had it figured out about fifteen minutes in and BOY was I wrong. 8/10 do recommend.
Its tagged as 'Horror' for a reason :^)
Saved the poor duckling, named it 'Darkwing Duck.' But... Darkwing Duck was in on it this whole time...  Darkwing Duck 7/10
Cute lil game..im sad though...♥♥♥♥♥ got me killed....
Can't trust hoes these days

The pixelated visuals of the game are good, giving it that classic touch. And it's nice to stroll around the park the first time.  After that it becomes a bit tedious walking back and forth to do the puzzles. I too didn't like the ending, as it seems pretty far fetched and gory. The last complaint is that in the end I can't skip the credits and the song, so i had to force close the game using the task manager.
Would totally help the little duckling again. I regret nothing!   Backtracking feels a bit tedious and controls are quite chunky.

Creepy feel to it, but there's not much here to call it a game. You pretty much just click to continue the narrative, there is no way to branch off the story. The most interesting part was when I was thinking about what else might happen by clicking other puzzle-looking things, but all were red herrings. I did like the dissonance of me being able to figure out what the Portuguese said while the Protagonist was completely in the dark.  Overall, a cool short story that was improved by it's medium, but definitely not a game. You decide whether you'd enjoy it more by clicking through yourself or by watching a video.
This game was torture to play even for the easy achievements.
Well, I guess it was free. If you want to kill 45 minutes then I guess you could run through this.
I would've loved to play this game but... I can't get the game to work. :( I've reinstalled and uninstalled many times and it still always has an error about a missing file? Yikes.
I would recommend this game, in the same way that I would recommend a long joke with a punchline that wasn't worth the wait. Not a bad joke though. Just.. not worth the setup.

A short but immersive little point and click game with a surprising story.. I like this game but it's hard to review without spoiling the story. So i'll say I enjoyed the simple writing and gameplay. Basic point and click, story driven game. and it was free so definitely worth a quick play through :D Oh and it's a horror!
Boy meets girl. Boy plans to meet girl in park. Obligatory spoiler alert. Girl is psychotic mass-murderer. Everybody dies except her. The end. Spare yourself the 10 minutes.

The back tracking was a bit tedious but it didn't draw away too much overall experience , the ending felt a little forced to me as if they just slapped it on to    shock you, which it does but I feel it pulls a mass effect 3 esque letdown
Free content, pretty good albiet predictable and kinda boring until the end. But free, so

Quite short. The best description is someone that took their vacation slide-show and turned it into a suspense point and click.   Very linear, but the achievements are fairly clever.   Since it's free and about 20 minutes long, its worth a playthrough.

I have a problem, when i try take the music box in the pipe, lou say 'I don't want to go around sticking my hands up random dirty old pipes' and, i don't know that make here, sorry for my bad english, i not speak so good this language
